alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:22PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN BAYFIELD AND NORTHWESTERN ASHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM CDT... At 420 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bayfield, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bayfield and La Pointe around 430 PM CDT. Red Cliff around 435 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Madeline Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. This storm may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. If in the Apostle Islands National Lakeshore near Basswood Island, get off or out of the water. This storm is tracking towards Stockton Island. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter inside a vehicle or sturdy structure now! Do not be caught on or in the water during a thunderstorm.
